content:
User: Same errors, this is the main.tf file.
Attached 1 file.
- image_98eb84.png

Gemini: Please perform these steps VERY CAREFULLY and in order:

VERIFY FILE PATH in FILE EXPLORER (not just Sublime Text):

Open WINDOWS FILE EXPLORER (not Git Bash, not Sublime Text).
Navigate to the directory: C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\terraform\
CONFIRM that you see a file named main.tf in this directory.
RIGHT-CLICK on the main.tf file in File Explorer.
Select "Open with" and choose "Notepad" (or a very basic text editor, not Sublime Text for this verification). This will open main.tf in Notepad.
VERIFY FILE CONTENT in NOTEPAD:

CAREFULLY compare the content you see in Notepad with the EXACT simplified code block I provided:

terraform {
  required_providers {
    google = {
      source  = "hashicorp/google"
      version = "6.20.0"
    }
  }
}

variable "project_id" {
  description = "GCP Project ID"
  type        = string
  default     = "ai-execution-system" # Replace with your actual Project ID if different
}

variable "region" {
  description = "GCP region"
  type        = string
  default     = "us-central1"
}

variable "service_name" {
  type    = string
  default = "ai-execution-system-core"
}


resource "google_cloud_scheduler_job" "health_check" {
  project   = var.project_id
  region    = var.region
  name      = "${var.service_name}-healthcheck"
  schedule  = "*/5 * * * *"
  time_zone = "UTC"
  http_target {
    http_method = "GET"
    uri         = "https://example.com/health" # Placeholder URI for now
  }
}
Is the content in Notepad EXACTLY this simplified code, with NO EXTRA LINES, NO EXTRA CODE, NO OLD CODE?

If there is ANY difference at all, carefully re-copy the simplified code block and PASTE it into Notepad, and then SAVE the file in Notepad.

After verifying the file path and content using File Explorer and Notepad:

Close Notepad.
Go back to your Git Bash terminal (in the C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\terraform\ directory).
Run terraform init -upgrade AGAIN:
terraform init -upgrade
Run terraform plan AGAIN:
terraform plan
The goal of these meticulous steps is to ELIMINATE ANY POSSIBILITY of Terraform reading an outdated or incorrect main.tf file. By verifying in File Explorer and Notepad, we bypass any potential issues with Sublime Text or hidden files.

Please perform these verification steps VERY carefully, and then run terraform init -upgrade and terraform plan again. Provide the EXACT output of both commands.

This detailed file verification is crucial to resolve these persistent errors. Let's be absolutely certain about the file itself! We are in the home stretch! LFG!
